title: Battlefield Picture Worsening for Ukraine as Trump Pushes Peace Plan
summary: Russian forces have advanced on several fronts recently. President Vladimir V. Putin signaled after talks with U.S. officials that he was not budging from demands.

title: Trump’s Security Doctrine Leaves Europe at a Strategic Crossroads
summary: A new White House policy document formalizes President Trump’s long-held contempt for Europe’s leaders. It made clear that the continent now stands at a strategic crossroads.

title: The Supreme Court, Once Wary of Partisan Gerrymandering, Goes All In
summary: The court’s conservative majority said that Texas’ asserted political motives justified letting the state use voting maps meant to disadvantage Democrats in the midterms.

title: Have Trump’s Tariffs Gone as High as They Can Go? Business Hope So
summary: A wave of companies are petitioning for exemptions from the Trump administration’s high levies on foreign-made goods, saying they are hurting business and raising prices.

title: Afrikaner Access Soars Amid Trump’s Policy Shift
summary: The white descendants of Europeans who colonized the country are getting greater access to American officials this year, both in Washington and in Pretoria.

title: Trump Accounts, Baby Bonds: Giving Directly to Kids Is an Idea Right and Left Could Love
summary: Michael and Susan Dell’s $6.25 billion donation to child savings accounts fits a trend: giving with no strings attached. In some ways, it’s a bipartisan philosophy.

title: One Step From Citizenship, Some Find It Alludes Their Grasp
summary: Sweeping immigration changes by the Trump administration have resulted in the cancellation of naturalization ceremonies, the last step in the process of becoming a citizen.

title: The Mayor-Elect of New Orleans Is Already Awash in Challenges
summary: A month before taking office, Helena Moreno is steering the city through a budget crisis and a Border Patrol enforcement operation that has immigrants in hiding.

title: Here’s How Trump Has Made It Harder for Migrants Seeking Asylum and Citizenship
summary: In the wake of the National Guard shooting, the Trump administration has temporarily frozen major pathways for many migrants to obtain legal status in the United States.

title: Angst Turns to Anger in Hollywood as Netflix Hooks Warner Bros.
summary: Much of the entertainment capital fears that Netflix’s deal will lead to more job losses and theater closings and fewer boundary-pushing movies.

title: What to Know About Netflix’s $83 Billion Deal for Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: The cash-and-stock deal would give the world’s largest paid streaming service expansive power over theater owners and entertainment-industry unions.

title: Frank Gehry’s Buildings Sound as Marvelous as They Look
summary: Gehry, who died on Friday at 96, made an invaluable contribution to classical music by designing spaces with stunning acoustics.

title: Frank Gehry: 12 Essential, Stunning Projects
summary: A singular genius, Gehry redefined architecture with joyful buildings like the Walt Disney Concert Hall in Los Angeles and the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao.

title: Inside the Yearslong Push to Bring the World Cup Final to New Jersey
summary: Winning the right to host the world’s most popular sporting event took years of planning, countless Zoom calls and a bit of luck with a broken-down bus.

title: Pete Hegseth Is Ordering Executions at Sea
summary: Did Pete Hegseth break the law after authorizing Venezuelan boat strikes? The Times Opinion editor, Kathleen Kingsbury, argues that there are multiple reasons the strikes were legally dubious.

title: The Supreme Court Is Failing at Its Most Important Job
summary: Until the court imposes limits, the administration will keep acting as if there are none.

title: Sweet Season
summary: Rejoice: NYT Cooking’s holiday cookie extravaganza has returned.

title: How Has Congestion Pricing Changed Your Year?
summary: The tolling program, decades in the making, has shown signs of being effective after a rocky rollout.

title: Survivors of the Deadly Hong Kong Fire Are in Limbo
summary: Hong Kong, with some of the world’s highest housing costs and inequality, must now figure out how to help thousands of residents who lost friends, family and homes.

title: Israel’s Plan to Back Gaza Militias Proves a Risky Gamble
summary: Officials said Israel helped arm and back Yasser Abu Shabab’s Popular Forces, part of a strategy against Hamas, before a local clan killed him this week.

title: Kidney Recipient Dies After Transplant From Organ Donor Who Had Rabies
summary: Only four donors have transmitted rabies to organ transplant recipients since 1978, according to federal officials.

title: Savings Accounts for Disabled People Are Expanding. Do You Qualify?
summary: Starting next year, people who became disabled by age 46 will be eligible to open ABLE accounts. The accounts have been slow to catch on, partly because the current age limit is 26.
